function_call.name: eval_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":["Potential spread of viruses in indoor environments due to lack of contactless systems and air purification.","Increased energy costs and greenhouse gas emissions if uv filter glass and transparent solar panels are not properly implemented.","Inadequate ventilation leading to poor indoor air quality and increased risk of disease transmission","Lack of proper cleaning strategies and technologies leading to increased pathogen transmission","Inadequate design for pandemic response leading to lack of emergency facilities and infrastructure","Utilizing uvgi technology without proper precautions for human exposure to uv radiation","Potential reliance on a single bio sensor for virus detection","Implementation of plastic barriers without proper maintenance and monitoring","Exposure to uv radiation from mobile uv devices","Ineffective or inadequate use of bipolar ionization devices","Failure to detect viruses in buildings","Inadequate understanding of paint nature and endurance","Improper installation or maintenance of air ionization systems","Use of copper touch surfaces in existing buildings","Need for more research on indoor plant requirements","Existing buildings not designed to reduce transmission of communicable diseases","Inadequate ventilation and air filtration in buildings","Ineffective disinfection systems for pathogen control","Potential exposure to harmful chemical disinfectants and sanitizers","Indoor air pollution from building materials and products","Nbpi may produce reactive ions and reactive oxygen species in the air, which could have unknown health effects.","Nbpi has been adopted in various types of buildings, but its effectiveness in controlling the transmission of contagious diseases like coronaviruses needs to be further studied.","Disinfectant fogging systems may pose a health risk if not properly regulated and applied, leading to exposure of building occupants to harmful chemicals.","Installation of uvgi without proper maintenance can lead to reduced effectiveness and potential health risks from exposure to uv light.","Inadequate research and regulation of air-purifying plants may lead to inconsistent efficacy and potential health risks from plant-related allergens or toxins.","Inconsistent implementation and maintenance of vertical greening systems may result in reduced air purification efficiency and potential structural damage to buildings","Use of hygienic flooring materials such as wood, bamboo, and cork may not be effective in preventing virus spread in indoor environments","Direct exposure to uv rays from germicidal sources can be harmful to human eyes and skin","Insufficient disinfection of air and surfaces in indoor environments may lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases","Survival of covid-19 virus on various materials may contribute to the spread of the virus","Insufficient ventilation due to conflicting guidelines on co2 concentration and airflow","Inadequate temperature and humidity control leading to virus persistence","Ineffective air filtration systems","Use of contactless systems","Indoor airborne transmission of covid-19 in crowded and poorly ventilated environments.","Reliance on ai for covid-19 detection and prediction","Reliance on ai-driven tools for accurate detection of covid-19 may lead to missed diagnoses and delayed treatment for individuals with other types of respiratory diseases.","Inadequate processing and integration of clinical, epidemiological, and genetic data","Inadequate training and certification of uv technicians"]}
